page.title: 17Transport. Local History.
page.content: A railway station was opened in Downton by Lady Nelson. At the end of the 19th century there was a railway disaster one mile south of Downton at Pile Bridge. Seven carriages crashed and many people were injured. Reverend Bunbury was in the second carriage and at his next visit to Downton thanked God that he was a survivor. The railway was closed on May 2nd, 1964. That Saturday, nearly 100 children under 11 years went on the last train journey to Braemore, arriving exactly on time. There was a scare when thick smoke was seen coming from the boiler and people thought that the engine might blow up. Despite the additonal weight of children the journay was made in record time and several hazards successfully negociated. The track has never been used since.
